name: Throw Your Keys Away
description:
A collection of small strips and short stories drawn during 2013 including the titular Throw Your Keys Away, I Almost Quit Drawing Comics and The Devil's Steps.

This book is A5, the covers are printed on 300gsm and pages on 170gsm premium smooth white uncoated paper, squareback bound. 24 interior pages.

Each book is personalised with a unique drawing of my choice on the dedication page.

name: Hey You! (and other stories)
description:
A collection of small strips and short stories drawn over the past year or so including the titular Hey You! The Grey Man, Men Who Climb and a travel journal from Algiers.

This book is A5, the covers are printed on 300gsm and pages on 170gsm premium smooth white uncoated paper, squareback bound.

Each book is personalised with a unique drawing of my choice on the dedication page.

Page 45's Book Of The Month for May 2013!

"My favourite book yet from the creator of AFTER WE SHOT THE GRIZZLY and CAT ISLAND – and that’s no easy feat.

Bound as ever in a quality card-stock cover here in white and lime greens, this beautiful short-story collection is a observational gem full of delicate pen-and-ink drawings, some with soft washes, others warm and bold, one midnight cold."

name: Cat Island
description:
Cat Island was drawn in just under 20 hours as part of the 24h de La Bande Dessinee event at the Maison Des Auteurs in Angouleme in January 2012.

It tells the story of a Man, a Woman a Baby and a Cat.

The covers are printed on 300gsm and pages on 170gsm premium smooth white uncoated paper, squareback bound.

Each book is personalised with a unique drawing of my choice on the dedication page.

"Cat Island is a great comic. Warm, emotive and funny, you'll love this... A great, great comic, and absolutely beautifully drawn as well. "
Richard Bruton, Forbidden Planet

name: After We Shot The Grizzly pdf Download
description:
Based on the song of the same name by The Handsome Family, After We Shot The Grizzly is a sorrowful tale of loss, life and love.
